page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: In 1830 Mr James Atherton purchased one hundred and seventy acres of sandhills and heathland in the area now known as New Brighton. Mr Atherton was a retired LIverpool merchant who had made his fortune in building and land speculation. His idea was to build houses in such a way that each building would have a fine view and be surrounded by plenty of land. The building would be situated so that one would not interfere with the view of another. Plans for New Brighton included the building of a church, market-place, shops, baths, reading rooms, billiard hall and a post office.
